content:
• Tuesday, February 28, 2017
  • SSW

    Seaspan beats by $0.03, revenues in-line, cuts dividend by 67%

    • Seaspan (NYSE:SSW) Q4 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $213.2M (+2.2% Y/Y) in-line.
    • Reduces quarterly dividend to $0.125 from $0.375.
    • SSW -11.7% AH.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 PM | 21 Comments
  • SFR

    Colony Starwood -1.4% on share sale

    • The offering size is 18.5M shares, of which 10.5M are being offered by certain selling shareholders, and the rest by the company. The underwriters have greenshoe options for about another 2.8M shares.
    • SFR -1.4% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 PM
  • DVAX

    FDA to review Dynavax's responses to HEPLISAV-B CRL, action date August 10; shares ahead 27% after hours

    • Dynavax Technologies (NASDAQ:DVAX) is up 27% after hours on robust volume in response to its announcement that the FDA has accepted for review its responses to the Complete Response Letter (CRL) it received last November regarding its Biologics License Application (BLA) for HEPLISAV-B. The agency's action date is August 10.
    • The CRL requested clarification regarding specific adverse events of special interest (AESIs) and a numerical imbalance in a small number of cardiac events in the HBV-23 study. It also cited the need for new analyses of the integrated safety database across different time periods and post-marketing commitments.
    • Previously: FDA rejects Dynavax's HEPLISAV-B marketing application; shares plummet 74% premarket (Nov. 14, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:23 PM | 45 Comments
  • TV

    Grupo Televisa -4.8% after ruling sets up tougher regulation

    • Grupo Televisa (NYSE:TV) dropped 4.8% after a regulator reversed course on a 2015 ruling and decided that Televisa does have market power in pay television.
    • That move sets up the prospect of tougher regulation. Last month, a Mexican tribunal threw out a ruling that said Televisa didn't have market power, forcing the Federal Telecommunications Institute to take up the matter again.
    • The IFT now says Televisa, the country's largest pay TV provider with about 60% of all subscribers, has "substantial market power."
    • The move brought Televisa off its highest point since last September (shares closed at $26.79 yesterday, and finished at $25.51 today).
     
     
     
     
    | 6:49 PM
  • INTC

    Intel downgraded to Underperform at Bernstein

    • From Market Perform, analyst Stacy Rasgon notes competitive challenges, signals datacenter is "cracking," pressured margins due to heightened investments, expensive valuation (considers "ripe for re-rating") and declining opportunities for growth and advantages in process.
    • Price target from $36 to $30. Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) $35.79, -1.13% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:20 PM | 68 Comments
  • FOX

    Fox to create single app to stream its networks' programming

    • Twenty-First Century Fox (FOX -2.2%, FOXA -1.7%) plans to build a single app that will unify online programming access across its American networks, including such channels as Fox, National Geographic and FX.
    • That means one sign-on rather than many, simplifying the process, Chairman Lachlan Murdoch told a Morgan Stanley investor conference.
    • A single app also has the benefit of giving the company more information about viewers, he said: “The more data we have on our customers, the better we are at having the capability to monetize through advertising to those consumers," noting that monetizing nonlinear viewing is up 30% with the help of better data usage.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • ENPH

    Enphase Energy -20% after missing Q4, guiding Q1 revenues below consensus

    • Enphase Energy (NASDAQ:ENPH) -20.1% AH after reporting a larger than expected Q4 loss and issuing downside guidance for Q1, seeing revenues of $60M-$65M vs. $73M analyst consensus estimate.
    • During Q4, ENPH says it sold 194 MW, or 815K microinverters; Q4 GAAP gross margin was 17.9%, and non-GAAP gross margin was 18.2%; ENPH expects Q1 GAAP and non-GAAP gross margin to come in at 16%-20%.
    • ENPH says it took incremental restructuring actions in Q1 2017, which it expects to result in an additional $18M of annualized non-GAAP operating expense savings starting in Q2.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM | 64 Comments
  • AMBA

    Ambarella -5%; Q4 2017 over estimates with revenue outlook off, $75M buyback authorized

    • Q4 2017 results – revenue $87.5M (+28.7% Y/Y, $1.43M above estimates), EPS $0.92 ($0.18 above estimates), gross margin 67.2% (vs. 64.1% Y/Y), net income $32M (vs. $21.6M Y/Y)
    • Other developments – Authorizes $75M share repurchase.
    • Q1 2018 projections – revenue $62.5M-$64.5M (consensus $69.61M), gross margin 63%-64.5%, operating expenses $26M-$27.5M
    • Ambarella president and CEO Fermi Wang: "During the year we continued to make progress in diversifying our markets and customer base and enjoyed significant revenue growth from home monitoring and drone markets, as well as building customer momentum in new OEM automotive applications. We entered mass production with our first 14nm SoCs, continued to raise the performance bar with the launch of our 4Kp60 Ultra HD SoCs and introduced our first automotive qualified solutions. Looking forward, we will continue to invest in computer vision technology, automotive solutions, and advanced 10nm process nodes, as we believe these efforts will provide significant additional opportunities for success in the future."
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:AMBA) $56
    • Press release / conference call
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM | 15 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: BGFV +14.5%. DAR +6.8%. ORA +5.0%. LXRX +4.4%. LOGM +4.1%.
    • Top losers: PANW -18.2%. SRPT -14.8%. EVHC -12.1%. CYBE -10.6%. QUMU -6.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • CRM

    Salesforce -1.66%; Q4 2017 over expectations, Q1 outlook light

    • Q4 2017 results – revenue $2.29B (+26.5% Y/Y, $10M above estimates), EPS $0.28 ($0.03 above estimates), operating cash flow $706M (+50% Y/Y), deferred revenue $5.54B (+29% Y/Y), unbilled deferred revenue $9B (+27% Y/Y)
    • Q1 2018 projections – revenue $2.34B-$2.35B (+22%-23% Y/Y; consensus $2.37B), EPS $0.25-$0.26 (consensus $0.30), deferred revenue +22%-23% Y/Y
    • FY 2018 projections – revenue $10.15B-$10.2B (+21%-22% Y/Y; consensus $10.15B), EPS $1.27-$1.29 (consensus $1.28), operating cash flow +20%-21% Y/Y
    • Salesforce chairman and CEO Marc Benioff: "Salesforce continues to deliver incredible innovation and unprecedented customer success. We led the industry as the first to bring cloud, social and mobile to CRM, and now with our latest release we are making artificial intelligence available to millions of Salesforce users with Einstein."
    • After hours – (NYSE:CRM) $80
    • Press release / conference call / summary deck
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • ACAD

    Acadia Pharma edges lower after sales top estimates

    • Q4 net product sales of $12M topped estimates by nearly $3M.
    • R&D expense of $30.2M vs. $20.5M a year ago; SG&A expense of $57.7M vs. $22.6 thanks to the sales force and costs from NUPLAZID.
    • Cash and cash equivalents on hand as of Dec. 31 of $529M vs. $215.1M a year earlier.
    • Conference call starts at 5 ET.
    • Previously: ACADIA Pharma EPS in-line, beats on revenue (Feb. 28)
    • ACAD -0.3% in active after hours action.
    • SA Contributor George Rho has published an informative article on the company. He believes the stock still has plenty of upside.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM | 71 Comments
  • HLIT

    Harmonic beats in Q4 as revenues jump 30%

    • Harmonic (HLIT -1.8%) has posted Q4 earnings that beat expectations after revenues rose more than 30%.
    • Net revenue on a non-GAAP basis rose to $113.8M, which was also up 11.9% sequentially. Bookings for Q4 were $116.9M, up 15.7% Y/Y.
    • Net loss narrowed on a GAAP basis to $10.4M. Non-GAAP net income rose to $6.7M from a year-ago $0.6M.
    • Revenue breakout: Product, $79.9M (up 29.5%); Service, $33.2M (up 33.3%). Among product revenues: Video products, $75.2M; Cable Edge, $4.8M.
    • Cash and equivalents came to $62.6M, up $9.9M Q/Q.
    • For Q1, the company's guiding (on a non-GAAP basis) to net revenue of $87M-$95M (light of expectations for $96.9M), gross margin of 53-54%, and EPS of -$0.08 to -$0.04.
    • Shares are back to flat in very choppy after-hours trading so far.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • WTW

    Weight Watchers pops after earnings satisfy

    • Weight Watchers (NYSE:WTW) skyrockets after the company tops estimates with its Q4 report.
    • Total paid weeks were up 10% during the quarter. Subscriber count also grew by 10%.
    • The company expects FY17 EPS of $1.30 to $1.40 to top the consensus estimate.
    • Previously: Weight Watchers beats by $0.02, misses on revenue (Feb. 28)
    • WTW +11.33% AH to $15.95. Shares were up over 21% during the session at one point.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • SRPT

    Sarepta -2% after Q4 results

    • Q4 non-GAAP net loss of $38.7M or $0.71 per share vs. loss of $58.3M and $1.30 one year ago.
    • Revenue of $5.4M recognized for EXONDYS 51 in Q4.
    • Non-GAAP R&D expense of $27.8M vs. $38.6M a year earlier. Non-GAAP SG&A expense of $16.1M vs. $20.7M.
    • Cash on hand of $329.3M vs. $204M a year ago, helped by two capital raises in 2016.
    • Conference call is getting underway now.
    • Previously: Sarepta Therapeutics beats by $0.62, beats on revenue (Feb. 28)
    • SRPT -2% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 8 Comments
  • ALR

    Alere informs Abbott of a "new issue" in Asia; shares off 4% today

    • Alere (NYSE:ALR) slumped 4% in the regular session a 70% spike in volume. Bloomberg reported that, in mid-February, it informed acquirer Abbott (NYSE:ABT) about a "new issue" in Asia, a day or two after it informed its own audit committee about the matter.
    • Alere says any notion that it is hiding information or not making disclosure is "completely contrary to the facts."
    • Abbott first announced its $5.8B takeover of Alere about a year ago, but has since tried to back out of the deal due to negative revelations about Alere's business practices, inappropriate revenue recognition and a government inquiry into its marketing and billing practices.
    • Previously: Abbott to back out of Alere deal (Dec. 7, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 17 Comments
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks -14.6%; Q2 2017 revenue and outlook off, LightCyber acquired, $500M buyback authorized

    • Q2 2017 results – revenue $422.6M (+26.3% Y/Y, $7.12M below estimates), EPS $0.63 ($0.01 above estimates), billings $561.6M (+22% Y/Y), deferred revenue $1.5B (+61% Y/Y), net income $59.6M (vs. $39.5M Y/Y), cash flow from operations $214.3M (+39% Y/Y), free cash flow $169.6M (+24% Y/Y)
    • Other developments – Acquires LightCyber for $105M cash, authorizes $500M share repurchase (marks total authorization at $1B).
    • Q3 2017 projections – revenue $406M-$416M (+17%-20%; consensus $454.63M), EPS $0.54-$0.56 (consensus $0.70)
    • Palo Alto Networks CEO Mark McLaughlin: "While fiscal second quarter revenue of $423 million was yet another record for the company, we were disappointed that we came in below top-line expectations due to some execution challenges, which we are moving quickly to address. Our customers rely on us to solve their most difficult cybersecurity challenges, and we have yet again widened the technology gap between our Next-Generation Security Platform and the competition with the largest product and features launch in our history, including expansion of our virtual and cloud capabilities. We are also extending our capabilities in data analytics and machine learning with today's announcement of our acquisition of LightCyber."
    • After hours – (NYSE:PANW) $129.75
    • Press release / conference call
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 37 Comments
  • ROST

    Sales hold up just fine at Ross Stores

    • Ross Stores (NASDAQ:ROST) reports comparable sales rose 4% in Q4 to top the expectation for a 2.8% rise.
    • The extra sales leverage helped Ross improve its operating margin rate by 90 bps to 13.6%.
    • The company's board approved a plan to buy back $1.75B worth of shares over two years.
    • Previously: Ross Stores beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Feb. 28)
    • ROST -1.43% AH to $67.60.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • WTW

    Weight Watchers beats by $0.02, misses on revenue

    • Weight Watchers (NYSE:WTW): Q4 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $267.4M (+3.2% Y/Y) misses by $6.8M.
    • Shares +4.73%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • PTLA

    Portola Pharmaceuticals beats by $0.17, beats on revenue

    • Portola Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PTLA): Q4 EPS of -$0.95 beats by $0.17.
    • Revenue of $13.7M (+210.7% Y/Y) beats by $9.72M.
    • Shares +1.1%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 3 Comments
  • ACAD

    ACADIA Pharma EPS in-line, beats on revenue

    • ACADIA Pharma (NASDAQ:ACAD): Q4 EPS of -$0.65 in-line.
    • Revenue of $12M beats by $2.95M.
    • Shares +1.68%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 12 Comments
  • LXRX

    FDA OKs Lexicon Pharma's telotristat etiprate for carcinoid syndrome

    • The FDA approves Lexicon Pharmaceuticals' (NASDAQ:LXRX) XERMELO (telotristat ethyl) 250 mg for the treatment of carcinoid syndrome diarrhea, in combination with somatostatin therapy (SSA) in adult patients inadequately controlled with SSA therapy.
    • Carcinoid syndrome is a rare condition that affects people with metastatic neuroendocrine tumors (mNETs).
    • XERMELO targets the overproduction of serotonin inside mNET cells. It will be available in select specialty pharmacies beginning March 6.
    • Update: Shares are up 8% after hours on increased volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 10 Comments
  • BGFV

    Big 5 Sporting Goods beats by $0.02, revenue in-line

    • Big 5 Sporting Goods (NASDAQ:BGFV): Q4 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $266.28M (-3.2% Y/Y) in-line.
    • Shares +2.23%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • ROST

    Ross Stores beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Ross Stores (NASDAQ:ROST): Q4 EPS of $0.77 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $3.51B (+8.0% Y/Y) beats by $50M.
    • Shares +2.07%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 12 Comments
  • NXST

    Nexstar -1.8% as record revenues still miss consensus

    • Nexstar Media Group (NASDAQ:NXST) is heading into the close down 1.8% after Q4 earnings missed though revenue and operating income hit records.
    • Revenues rose 22.8% to $309.9M; operating income was $92.5M, and EBITDA of $134.8M beat an expected $128.8M.
    • Revenue breakout: Local, $101.9M (down 0.8%); National, $36.2M (down 12.5%); Political revenue, $60M (up 661%); Retransmission fees, $100.3M (up 22.8%); Digital, $25.75M (down 12.1%); Trade and Barter, $10.9M (down 11.7%).
    • With its acquisition of Media General complete, Nexstar is expecting average annual free cash flow in the 2017-2018 cycle of about $565M, says CEO Perry Sook. That's about $12/share, based on estimates of about $81M in year-one synergies.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • LNG

    U.S. set to export first LNG on Canada's behalf from Cheniere's Sabine Pass

    • Cheniere Energy (LNG -2.1%) is lower despite reported its first unadjusted quarterly profit now that revenue is streaming in regularly (Q4 results).
    • LNG says it it is set to receive Canadian supplies from the Montney shale play, part of the company’s strategy to tap into different supply basins after opening up its landmark gas export terminal at Sabine Pass in Louisiana a year ago.
    • LNG is thus achieving what opponents of the Keystone XL oil pipeline wanted to prevent: bringing resources from Canada that could end up being exported from the U.S.
    • “This is a great potential outlet" for Cheniere, Pira Energy Group's Madeline Jowdy tells Bloomberg, since strident opposition has made British Columbia's various proposed export projects look like they are going to be a long time coming, if ever.
    • LNG has two of its natural gas liquefaction facilities online and producing gas for export at Sabine Pass, with a third train expected to come online in March, a fourth scheduled for the fall, a fifth seen finished by 2019, and a sixth without a timetable so far.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 14 Comments
  • LXRX

    Trading in Lexicon Pharma halted pending news

    • Nasdaq has suspended trading in Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (LXRX -2.5%) pending news. Today is the FDA's action date for its marketing application for telotristat etiprate for carcinoid syndrome.
    • The original action date (PDUFA) was November 30, 2016 but was extended after the company submitted additional clinical data.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 2 Comments
  • BHC

    Valeant's ugly Q4 and soft guidance belies Papa's turnaround story; shares down 14%

    • Valeant Pharmaceuticals' (VRX -13.8%) almost 30% rally since late January seems like a distant memory after it posted Q4 and full-year results earlier today that showed declines across its businesses. The company did itself no favors by stating that it would provide guidance on cash flow ops and net income, but didn't provide any. It added that it will no longer provide an outlook for non-GAAP net income or non-GAAP EPS.
    • Unsurprisingly, analysts lack confidence that the company can, indeed, reverse its fortunes.
    • Wells Fargo's David Maris: Investors should scrutinize the company's claims of a turnaround very carefully since "all franchises appear to be stagnating or in decline." Estimates interest coverage ratio of 2.07x, "very close" to its 2.0x covenant. Rating: Hold.
    • Mizuho's Irina Koffler: Management's expectations of 2 - 5% growth in Rx and 5 - 7% growth for B&L in 2017 are "unrealistic." Rating: Underperform.
    • RBC's Douglas Miehm: Non-GAAP EBITDA forecast of $3.55B - 3.70B below his target of $3.8B and below consensus of $3.9B. Guidance likely conservative, however.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • According to a Barron's article, an analyst at independent corporate bond research firm Gimme Credit says the company only paid down $1.2B in debt last year so its leverage is tracking to mid-high 7x this year depending on how much debt can be paid down via asset sales. The company's April 2026 notes are currently yielding 9.4%, reflecting the expected increased risk.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 274 Comments
  • ORBC

    Orbcomm rises 4.7% as it guides to service sales growth

    • Orbcomm (NASDAQ:ORBC) has gained 4.7% after posting Q4 earnings where revenues missed but the company guided on its earnings call to service revenues growing 5-8% in the coming year.
    • EPS went from break-even last year to a $0.05 loss, and ex-items went from a year-ago $0.01 gain to a $0.04 loss. But EBITDA grew to $12.5M, which beat an expected $12.3M.
    • For the full year, service revenues were up 13% to a record $112.9M, and EBITDA rose 12% to $47.3M.
    • Revenue breakout: Service revenues, $29.4M (up 8.4%); Product sales, $17.4M (down 2.5%).
    • In a new approach to guidance after difficulty timing sales and installations, for the full year Orbcomm is forecasting service revenues of $118M-$122M (5-8% growth) and product sales from $80M-$110M. Consensus expectations for total revenue sit at $209.8M.
    • It sees adjusted EBITDA margins of 25-27% of total revenues, depending on its eventual hardware/services mix.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • FPO

    Rough session for office REITs led by First Potomac

    • Evercore earlier said property comps at First Potomac (FPO -4.4%) are going to become more difficult this year thanks to higher occupancy rates. With planned asset sales nearly complete, the company needs to be on the lookout for acquisitions to help growth, or perhaps use equity capital to cut leverage.
    • Government Properties (GOV-OLD -1.9%), Equity Commonwealth (EQC -2.3%), Washington Real Estate (WRE -1.7%), City Office (CIO -1.1%)
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • GME

    GameStop -9% after new Xbox subscription plan unveiled

    • GameStop (NYSE:GME) is down 9.28% on heavy volume after Microsoft announces a new $9.99 subscription for the Xbox.
    • The Xbox Game Pass will debut this spring.
    • Baird doubles down on it Outperform rating on GME, recommending that investors buy into today's weakness.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 20 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: WUBA +12%. TTD +12%. IPDN +11%. LTRX +11%. LFGR +9%.
    • Losers: I -16%. FTR -11%. DDD -10%. SITO -9%. PDVW -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar rated a Sell by Axiom solar bear Johnson

    • First Solar (FSLR -4.4%) is initiated with a Sell rating and $21 price target at Axiom Capital, which says the six large legacy projects the company has used to bolster earnings in recent years are now gone.
    • The projects allowed FSLR to “defer high-quality revenue and margins to future periods, providing years of EPS buffer during earnings down-cycles,” but now those projects are gone, Axiom's Gordon Johnson writes, "so now the company has to compete on the merits of its technology, and, quite frankly, I don’t think they can compete against the Chinese."
    • Johnson also criticizes FSLR’s 8Point3 Energy Partners (CAFD -0.4%) yield company, which uses non-amortizing revolver debt "when they should be using amortizing term debt like every other yieldco."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 38 Comments
  • SDRL

    Seadrill still -12% after Chapter 11 warning

    • Seadrill (SDRL -12.5%) maintains heavy losses after warning that it could be forced into bankruptcy protection in two months, as well as risks of ”substantial dilution” of bonds converting into equity.
    • A lending facility linked to the West Eminence, one of the company’s rigs, matures on April 30, the same date as a “milestone” under amendments to the company’s bank facilities agreed last year.
    • Canaccord Genuity notes that Q4 results showed a strong operational performance but little chance of any significant accretion of value from customer contracts in the next 12-18 months; the firm sees a real possibility that SDRL might need to seek protection from its creditors in an insolvency after the April 30 deadline.
    • DNB Marekts considers a bond conversion to equity a positive from a company perspective, but sees a risk of shareholders being marginalized in the restructuring.
    • Simmons analysts believes a pending bankruptcy at SDRL has looked inescapable for some time; all three firms rate the stock a Sell.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 26 Comments

  • Afternoon bounce for oil on White House, OPEC news

    • First up was a White House denial of rumors it's putting together an executive order to rescind ethanol mandates.
    • Next was a Reuters survey showing OPEC continues to deliver on promised supply cuts, with members now having achieved 1.098M b/d of reductions vs. 1.164M pledged, or 94% compliance.
    • Oil has added about $0.60 since the stories hit, but remains lower on the session by 0.4% at $53.83 per barrel.
    • USO -0.6%
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UCO, SCO, BNO, DBO, DTO, UGA, USL, DNO, OLO, UHN, SZO, OLEM, DWT, OILK, OILX, UWT
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 16 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: LXU +22%. ALB +10%. ICD +10%. GLF +8%. DK +6%.
    • Losers: IPI -12%. SDRL -12%. TELL -11%. SDLP -9%. AREX -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • QRTEA

    Liberty Interactive -7.8% as U.S. QVC drags sales

    • Liberty Interactive (QVCA) is off 7.8% now after its Q4 revenues missed expectations as QVC Group sales fell 3%.
    • EBITDA at that group dipped 2% to $610M, and its net income fell 15%. Gross margins dipped at QVC U.S. and international as well, while they increased by nearly 2 percentage points at Zulily.
    • Revenue by segment: QVC US, $1.95B (down 7%); QVC International, $711M (flat); Zulily, $467M (up 10%).
    • “Internationally, QVC continues to perform well, while domestically we are focusing on strengthening a few merchandise categories that have been weak,” says CEO Greg Maffei.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM | 3 Comments
  • ENDP

    Cowen's Cacciatore doesn't see upside in Endo, cuts price target to $16; shares up 5% after Q4 beat

    • Cowen and Company's Ken Cacciatore says Endo International's (ENDP +5%) continued exposure to mesh liability payments and high leverage make it a value trap since its operations are not generating enough cash to pay down the debt. He has reduced his price target to $16 (14% upside) from $30.
    • Mr. Cacciatore adds that Shire (SHPG -1.4%) and Allergan (AGN -0.4%) are more attractive plays. He rates both Outperform with price targets of $181 and $245, respectively.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM | 60 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: SBY +18%. CARV +12%. IPCC +5%.
    • Losers: NNI -15%. AMTD -11%. ETFC -8%. AIII -8%. SSBI -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • ALB

    Albemarle +10% after Q4 beat; guides 2017 revenues above consensus

    • Albemarle (ALB +9.7%) surges to 52-week highs after posting better than expected Q4 earnings and revenues, and ending 2016 with ~$2.3B in cash, a more than 10x Y/Y increase.
    • ALB issues FY 2017 guidance, seeing EPS of $4.00-$4.25 vs. $4.10 analyst consensus estimate on revenues of $2.80B-$2.95B vs. $2.78B consensus.
    • For Q4, sales from the lithium and advanced materials unit jumped 30% Y/Y to $278M, bromine specialties sales gained 13% to $194.5M, and revenues from the refining solutions unit fell 4% to $193M.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 2 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

  • ACIU

    Genentech readies second late-stage study of crenezumab in Alzheimer's; licensor AC Immune up 3%

    • Thinly traded AC Immune SA (ACIU +2.6%) perks up on modestly higher volume in response to Genentech's (OTCQX:RHHBY) decision to start a second Phase 3 study called CREAD2 assessing crenezumab in patients with mild Alzheimer's disease.
    • Top-line data from the first Phase 3, CREAD1, are expected in 2020.
    • Crenezumab is a fully humanized IgG4 monoclonal antibody that binds to all forms of misfolded Abeta proteins, especially Abeta oligomers, to prevent and break up Abeta aggregation and promote Abeta disaggregation. Tau and beta amyloid (Abeta) are associated with neurodegeneration. Tangles and aggregations in the brain characterize Alzheimer's disease.
    • The company out-licensed crenezumab to Genentech in 2006.

  • VLO

    Bloomberg: Trump considers biofuel plan brought by Icahn, ethanol group

    • Refining stocks are mostly higher after Bloomberg reports that Pres. Trump is considering a plan submitted by Carl Icahn and the Renewable Fuels Association that would shift the point of obligation for RINs away from refiners and toward fuel blenders.
    • Oil refiners, including Valero Energy (VLO +2.2%) and CVR Energy (CVI +3.2%), have long sought such a change, saying the structure of the U.S. biofuels program hits them with burdensome costs.
    • Prices for biofuel credits plunged 35% on the news while futures contracts for corn, the raw material used to manufacture ethanol, surged.
    • The biofuels trade group had just this month filed comments with the EPA opposing the move, but now it has agreed to back the change in return for a pledge for a waiver allowing gasoline blends containing 15% ethanol to be sold year-round in U.S. markets.
    • Growth Energy, a separate group of biofuel supporters including Green Plains (GPRE +5%), blasts the reported deal, saying "this is no deal for anyone but Carl Icahn."

  • TGT

    Target in the crosshairs

    • Target (TGT -11.8%) CFO Catherine Smith says the company will invest $2B into the business this year and $7B over the next three years. The investments from the retailer will include backing its increased shift to digital, pricing and supporting new brands.
    • The company will also increase its focus on the small-store format, with more than 100 smaller stores expected to be operating within three years. About 600 stores will be refurbished over the same three-year timeframe.
    • Consumer Edge Research analyst David Schick: "The early look at the reset includes accelerated investments in a network of physical and digital assets and lower gross margins to be competitively priced."
    • Baird: The firm notes the company is taking the "difficult" steps to reset its financial plan.
    • Bloomberg Intelligence: Analyst Jennifer Bartashus questions if the low pricing strategy will actually lead to traffic gains. The strategy on food is also questioned.
    • UBS on the Q4 numbers: "On a 2-year stack, it represents a -130 bps sequential deceleration. Its store contribution to its comp was -3.3 percent, which was partially offset by a 1.8 percent contribution from digital."
    • Retail analyst Rahul Sharma: "$TGT caught in headlights between $WMT & $AMZN. Not enough food to keep store traffic up, not enough non-food wow to compensate."

  • KITE

    Kite's lead product candidate successful in late-stage blood cancer study

    • Kite Pharma (NASDAQ:KITE) announces positive results from its Phase 3 ZUMA-1 study assessing lead product candidate axicabtagene ciloleucel (formerly KTE-C19) in patients with chemo-resistant aggressive B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL). The trial met its primary endpoint demonstrating an 82% objective response rate after a single infusion of axicabtagene ciloleucel (p<0.0001).
    • The complete response rate was 36% at month 6. Median overall survival has not been reached (median follow-up period of 8.7 months).
    • The most common grade 3 (severe) or higher adverse events were anemia (43%), neutropenia (39%), decreased neutrophil count (32%), febrile neutropenia (31%), decreased white blood cell count (29%), thrombocytopenia (24%), encephalopathy (21%) and decreased lymphocyte count (20%).
    • The company plans to complete its rolling BLA submission in the U.S. by the end of next month. Its marketing application in Europe for three blood cancers (DLBCL, PMBCL, TFL) will be submitted this year.
    • Axicabtagene ciloleucel is an investigational therapy in which the patient's T cells are genetically modified to express a CAR (chimeric antigen receptor) that targets the CD19 antigen, a protein expressed on the surface of B-cell lymphoma and leukemia cells. This enables the T cells to locate and kill the cancer cells. If approved, it will be the first CAR T therapy commercially available in the U.S.
    • Nasdaq has not reported any premarket trades this morning.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 11 Comments
